title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger criticised by Ian Wright over defence | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 8:02 am Arsene Wenger has been criticised over his lack of defensive preparation (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal legend Ian Wright believes Arsene Wenger has to be held responsible for removing the club’s culture of building on the foundation of a strong defence from the George Graham era. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The Frenchman’s predecessor was well known for building tightly drilled sides who were hard to beat, with key figures like Tony Adams and Steve Bould also serving Wenger well in the early part of his Arsenal career. 
However, the Gunners have become known for being something of a soft touch for much of the last decade or so, with Wenger failing to adequately replace those players or organise his back four in a similar fashion again. Wenger’s side face a daunting trip to Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Wright feels that lack of versatility to Arsenal’s tactics has hurt them in the big games, despite also praising Wenger for giving the team more of an attacking edge in his time at the club. 
‘Arsenal feel much more comfortable with ball,’ Wright told Suddeutsche. ‘Pushing up, pushing up spaces and conquering the ball is not their game. 
‘This is the hard part of football which nobody likes to do (in) this team. A good six-meter sprint at the front can save you the 30-meter-way further back, but from Arsenal we see that only in the first few minutes of games, if at all.
